tut_name: Motion Capture for Source Filmmaker Part 1 - Setting up your Kinects and Calibrating
tut_description: In this series of tutorial videos I show you how to record motion and import it as an animation into Source Filmmaker. This part focuses on getting your motion capture software set up.

tut_name: Motion Capture for Source Filmmaker Part 2 - Recording the Action
tut_description: Part 2 of my tutorial series on using iPiSoft to capture motion for Source Filmmaker. In this video I show you how to record the actions you'll create animations with.

tut_name: Motion Capture for Source Filmmaker Part 3 - Processing the Recorded Action
tut_description: In Part 3 of this tutorial I show you how to process the actions you recorded in Part 2.

tut_name: Motion Capture for Source Filmmaker Part 4 - Mapping the Model
tut_description: In this part of the tutorial I show you how to update a TF2 model to be ready for animation by exporting it from Maya and editing it in MotionBuilder.

tut_name: Motion Capture for Source Filmmaker Part 5 - Creating a Bone Naming Template
tut_description: In this tutorial I show you how to create a bone naming template for your animations exported from iPiSoft, which we will use later to quickly map characters to your motion capture data.

tut_name: Motion Capture for Source Filmmaker Part 6 - Exporting the Animation
tut_description: In this tutorial segment I show you how to export the animation you created to a DMX file suitable for import into Source Filmmaker.

tut_name: Motion Capture for Source Filmmaker Part 7 - Importing the animation to SFM
tut_description: In this tutorial we bring the animation we created in the previous tutorial segments into Source Filmmaker.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #1
tut_description: How to use the SHIFT key in conjunction with your mouse to scrub the timeline, and hopefully clears up some confusion that you may have from the Valve tutorials.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #2 - Replacing Models
tut_description: How to fix problems you might run into by having imported the wrong model for your animations

tut_name: Tip of the Day #3 - Importing models from Garry's Mod
tut_description: How you can import a custom model from garrysmod.org

tut_name: Tip of the Day #4 - Using Sprays in Source Filmmaker
tut_description: How to use Sprays in TF2 within Source Flimmaker

tut_name: Tip of the Day #5 - Using Particle Systems
tut_description: How to spawn and use particle systems in Source Filmmaker by linking the 'Domination' particle to a soldier and having him run around with it.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #6 - Stop recording entities twice!
tut_description: How to avoid recording things like medical crates, ammo crates, particles and other objects in the game world twice when recording your SFM movies.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #7 - Getting rid of extra cameras
tut_description: How to get rid of all the extra cameras you collect while doing takes in SFM. Bonus content, I show you how to change camera names and adjust some other properties.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #8 - Using Keyframes to modify an existing animation
tut_description: How you can take an existing sequence you have recorded (in this case, a Scout running through the scene) and modify some elements while leaving others alone.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #9 - Using the Source Filmmaker Logo animation
tut_description: How you can load and explore the Source Filmmaker Logo animation, which is not only included with Source Filmmaker, but was actually made in Source Filmmaker.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #10 - Using HL2 maps in Source Filmmaker
tut_description: How to use GCFScape, VMEX and Hammer to get your favorite HL2 map into Source Filmmaker.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #11 - Using locks for fun and profit
tut_description: How to use locks by creating a spy, attaching a cigarette to his hand, animating him, and putting a smoke particle effect on the cigarette in his hand.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #12 - Accessing sounds recorded by Source Filmmaker
tut_description: How to find the sounds that SFM will automatically put in the scene when you record a scene

tut_name: Tip of the Day #13 - Focal Distance and Aperture
tut_description: How to adjust focal distance and aperture on your cameras in Source Filmmaker, allowing you to create interesting focal and zoom effects- such as making the foreground object blurry while the background is crisp, and vice versa.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #14 - Using SSAO to improve your movies and posters
tut_description: How to adjust the settings for SSAO (Screen Space Ambient Occlusion) to produce better shadows and lighting for your posters and movies.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #15 - Making a model's eyes follow the camera
tut_description: how to make a model's eyes follow the camera around. This technique can also be used to make the model's eyes follow another object, entity or model as you desire.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #16 - The Default and Zero Presets
tut_description: In today's tip I go over the Default and the Zero animation presets and discuss what they do and how they're different- and why you sometimes find yourself having to use one or the other.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #17 - The Lens Presets
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I give you a brief overview of the Source Filmmaker Lens Presets and how you can use them to adjust your field of view to a set of standard angles.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #18 - The In, Out, Paste and Drop Presets
tut_description: In today's tip of the day I show you how you can use the In, Out, Paste and Drop Procedural Presets in Source Filmmaker.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #19 - The Left and Right Stereo controls for facial animations
tut_description: In today's tip I show you how to use the Left and Right stereo controls to adjust how facial animations are applied.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #20 - Importing portions of an animation set
tut_description: How to export and import specific portions of an animation set, such as the facial expression of a Spy

tut_name: Tip of the Day #21 - Using the Rotation Tool for Fun and Profit
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how you can change the behavior of the rotation tool to allow you to lock rotation to the world or to change the center of rotation for a selected object.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #22 - Resetting the Pivot Handle
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day, I show you how to reset the pivot handle on a model once it's been moved. I also show you a few other tricks with the pivot handles.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #23 - The Stagger Preset
tut_description: In today's Tip, I show you how to use the Stagger Procedural Preset to potentially make your animations more lifelike.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #24 - Using the Particle System Editor
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I introduce you to the Particle System Editor in Source Filmmaker, a tool you can use to create or modify your own particle systems.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #25 - Transform, Overwrite and Offset in the Motion Editor
tut_description: In today's tip I give a quick demonstration of the differences between Transform, Overwrite and Offset in the Motion Editor of Source Filmmaker.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #26 - Gibbing your characters
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to add the 'gibbing' effect to make your posed models explode as though they were detonated by a sticky, etc.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #27 - Adjusting timing of individual elements of a shot
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to adjust the timing of an individual element of your shot- such as a recorded model or spawned entity, even a camera, whether or not it has an animation set.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #28 - Doing fades with the clip editor and toneMapScale
tut_description: In today's tip I show you how to do fades of your shots using both the Clip Editor and the toneMapScale slider on an animated camera.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #29 - Removing Decals from the scenery
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to use the console command 'r_cleardecals' to remove the bullet holes, blood and other effects that end up on your background scenery when recording in Source Filmmaker.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #30 - Auto Aiming the Work Camera
tut_description: In today's tip I discuss how to use the 'Auto Aim' feature for the Work Camera.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #31 - Changing the Falloff Interpolation
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I discuss the details of the Falloff Interpolation presets, which allow you to change how movements in the Motion Editor are applied- Linear, Ease In, Ease Out, and Ease In and Out.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #32 - Changing the appearance of your shots in the overview
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to adjust the color, name and text associated with the clips in the Clip Editor to help you organize your shots more easily.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #33 - Creating Custom Color Correction Effects
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I demonstrate how you can create your own custom color corrections for your SFM movies. In this one I do a 'film noir' effect, but your options are limited only by your imagination.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #34 - Adding Text Overlays and Title Cards
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to create simple text overlays and add them to your animations as title cards.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #35 - Destroying sentries for fun and profit
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to animate a sentry explosion, how to move its location and adjust its timing to synchronize with another event.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #36 - Freezing Particle Systems
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to freeze a particle system in place, so you can do things like frozen explosions or blood spatter in a still life, and animate other elements such as a camera.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #37 - Creating Light Kits
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to create a 'Light Kit', and discuss a little bit about lighting

tut_name: Tip of the Day #38 - Setting the Near and Far Distance of a Camera
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to set the minimum and maximum distance of a camera's 'vision', which you can use to produce interesting effects.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #39 - Making a Camera Track a Model
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to make a camera pan to track a moving model, in this case a Scout running across a scene.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #40 - Using Constraints for Fun and Profit
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to use Orientation Constraints to make models move together- for example to make two sentries move simultaneously when changing one.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #41 - Rule of Thirds
tut_description: In today's tip, I discuss the 'Rule of Thirds' and how it can improve your SFM videos.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #42 - The SHIFT and CTRL Movement Modifiers
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day, I show you how to use SHIFT and CTRL to change movement speed for more accurate positioning of a camera and for accurate movement when puppeteering a camera.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #43 - Manipulating Lights as Cameras
tut_description: A bit under the weather tonight so the more complex TOTD I'm working on will have to wait. In the meantime I give you a tip on how to manipulate a light just like you do a camera.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #44 - Projecting Images via Light Gobo Textures
tut_description: In today's tip of the day I show you a little bit about how to use gobo textures to project images onto surfaces in your SFM scenes, and discuss what you can and can't do with them.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #45 - Making ragdolls of your models
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to make your recorded models turn into ragdolls on command.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #46 - Extracting Models from TF2 and other Source Games
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to extract models from the TF2 distribution so you can get all the new hats, weapons and other goodies that aren't in the base SFM distribution. You can apply this technique to other Source games as well.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #47 - Remapping Slider Ranges
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how you can remap the ranges of the various sliders used in SFM to limit values applied to animation sets.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #48 - Slow In, Slow Out- Realistic Movement in SFM
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I depart from some of my previous tutorials and delve a bit into animation theory, discuss how objects move in the real world and how you can more effectively emulate them in SFM.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #49 - Frozen cameras and animations in long shots and how to correct it
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I describe a problem you may run into if you work with very long shots (longer than 60 seconds) which is characterized by any animations freezing and being unable to be modified. I show you why it happens and how to correct it.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #50 - Using Helpers for Fun and Profit
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to use 'helpers' in Source Filmmaker to allow you to manipulate objects more easily and to create indirect locks.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #51 - Deleting Sample Data for Fun and Profit
tut_description: In today's tip of the day I show you how to delete portions of the sample data associated with an animation set to produce various effects.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #52 - Movie Export Settings
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I take you on a brief tour of the Movie Export settings and discuss what the various options do.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #53 - Using Field of View and Camera Position for Fun and Profit
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to play around with lens presets to do zoom effects similar to what you may have seen in other films, such as the 'scare zoom'.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #54 - Accessing Hidden Controls on Rigged Models
tut_description: In today's Tip, I show you how to access the hidden controls of a rigged model so you can do things like use the weapon bone to parent to another model, even when the model is rigged (and the weapon bone hidden).

tut_name: Tip of the Day #55 - The History Window
tut_description: I show you how to use the History window which can simplify the process of undoing changes instead of spamming CTRL-Z

tut_name: Tip of the Day #56 - The Key Mapping Window
tut_description: In today's Tip I show you the Key Bindings window and discuss some of the commands available in Source Filmmaker that you may not have been aware of.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #57 - Removing pieces of a model and changing skins
tut_description: In today's tip I show you how to remove pieces of a model, such as the Soldier's grenades and the Medic's backpack.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #58 - Using Offset Mode in the Graph Editor for Fun and Profit
tut_description: In today's tip I show you a bit about how offset mode can allow you to modify existing animation curves in the Graph Editor without destroying the base animation.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #59 - Using the Work Camera Lock for Fun and Profit
tut_description: In today's Tip I show you how to use the Work Camera Lock to allow you to make the Work Camera follow models automatically.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #60 - Setting Time Scales in your Shots
tut_description: In today's Tip I show you how to adjust the timescale of your shots, and discuss some of the underlying elements of how SFM processes animation set data to produce what we call a 'shot'.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #61 - Adjusting the Time Scale of Individual Animation Sets Within a Shot
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I take you through how to adjust the scale of each element of a shot, similar to how you might adjust the timing of a shot as I showed in Tip of the Day #60.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #62 - The Spline, Ramp and Round Presets
tut_description: In today's Tip I show you how to use the Ramp, Spline and Round Procedural Presets in Source Filmmaker.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #63 - Beards, Pipes and Particles, Oh My
tut_description: In today's tip, I discuss how to work with some of the Steam Workshop items that have been added to Team Fortress 2, such as beards.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #64 - Making the All-Father Beard Visible
tut_description: In today's tip I take you through the process of updating the All-Father model so you can get that beard working right in SFM!

tut_name: Tip of the Day #65 - Hiding and Showing Track Groups
tut_description: In today's Tip, I show you how to show and hide Track Groups to keep your SFM workspace less cluttered.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #66 - Copying and Pasting Sample Data
tut_description: In today's Tip I discuss how to copy and paste animation sample data from one model to another, as well as some of the underlying mechanics of how it works.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #67 - Applying Class-Based Character Particle Effects
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to access the various class-based particle systems and demonstrate using the Eyelander eye effect on a heavy

tut_name: Tip of the Day #68 - Enabling and Disabling the Selectability of Animation Sets
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to prevent animation sets from being selectable in the viewport and why you might want to do so.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #69 - Changing the Color of Your Animation Set Labels
tut_description: In today's Tip I show you an organizational method to keep your more complex scenes with lots of animation sets more easily managed by changing the color of the labels in the Animation Set Editor.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #70 - Replacing the Pyro's mask and using Body Groups
tut_description: In today's tip of the day, I show you how to use Body Groups and Locks to replace the Pyro's mask with the Last Breath or other Pyro masks.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #71 - Using the 'Import Sequence' dialog for fun and profit!
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I discuss how to use the various features of the 'Import Sequence' dialog to adjust how your imported sequences affect the models you're working with.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #72 - Applying Cloaking Effects to Models
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to apply the Spy's cloaking effect to models in Source Filmmaker- without having to download scripts or extra files, and without having to go through all the hassle of the way it used to be.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #73 - Quickly adding TF2 items to your models
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day, I discuss how you can quickly and easily add TF2 items to your models without having to go through a bunch of extra steps, thanks to Valve's addition of a fine feature to SFM.

tut_name: Tip of the Day #74 - Getting the new DLC (Portal 2, DoD, Blade Symphony) into SFM easily
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how to add the new free DLC included with Source Filmmaker- Portal 2, Day of Defeat, Blade Symphony

tut_name: Tip of the Day #75 - Using Slugs
tut_description: In today's Tip of the Day I show you how you can put slugs (blank shots) to use in your animations.
